properties.name: mask
properties.description: The mask to apply, which can be a Container or null. If null, it clears the existing mask. ```ts // Set a mask sprite.setMask({ mask: graphics, inverse: false, });

properties.name: filters
properties.description: Sets the filters for the displayObject. Filters are visual effects that can be applied to any display object and its children. > [!IMPORTANT] This is a WebGL/WebGPU only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer. ```ts new Container({ filters: [new BlurFilter(2), new ColorMatrixFilter()], }); ```

properties.name: inverse
properties.description: The Mask type represents different ways to mask a display object. - A number represents a mask ID. - A Container represents a mask object, such as a Graphics or Sprite. - null indicates that no mask is applied. ```ts // Using a Container as a mask const maskContainer: Mask = new Graphics(); // Using a mask ID const maskId: Mask = 123; // No mask applied const noMask: Mask = null; ``` / export type Mask = number | Container | null; /** Options for configuring mask behavior on a display object. ```ts // Basic mask inversion sprite.setMask({ mask: graphics, inverse: true }); ``` / export interface MaskOptions { /** Whether the mask should be inverted. When true, the masked area becomes transparent and the unmasked area becomes visible. ```ts // Invert the mask sprite.setMask({ mask: graphics, inverse: true }); ```
